title: Dazzy7
author: Dazzy7
content: I've been in the crypto space since 2019, and have Been on all the highs and lows, I recently won 2.2M on Stake.com. I have no idea what to do with it or how to use it. I'm thinking about starting to make a really good affiliate book on stake, as I noticed it can get really good, Of course, I would be doing giveaways leaderboards and all that, I also need help to navigate a bit as I'm new here, Heard of bitcointalk in 2020 but it looked really confusing, Still kinda isÂ   . Anyways If you guys have any suggestions of what I should do let me know, Cheers.

comments.author: owlcatz
comments.body: Quote from: Dazzy7 on December 02, 2022, 11:56:19 PMI've been in the crypto space since 2019, and have Been on all the highs and lows, I recently won 2.2M on Stake.com. I have no idea what to do with it or how to use it. I'm thinking about starting to make a really good affiliate book on stake, as I noticed it can get really good, Of course, I would be doing giveaways leaderboards and all that, I also need help to navigate a bit as I'm new here, Heard of bitcointalk in 2020 but it looked really confusing, Still kinda isÂ   . Anyways If you guys have any suggestions of what I should do let me know, Cheers. Withdraw it then come back and tell us how it went please..

comments.author: Aanuoluwatofunmi
comments.body: Quote from: Dazzy7 on December 02, 2022, 11:56:19 PMI recently won 2.2M on Stake.com. I have no idea what to do with it or how to use it.Divide your money into three parts, use some part of your winning to invest on bitcoin and follow the DCA purchasing pattern, keep your coins on the wallet and not centralized exchanges, use another portion for your intended stake affiliate book and the last portion into another physical form of asset that can be visible to you and accessible, a good example is gold or real estate.

comments.author: cryptoaddictchie
comments.body: Wow thats huge. Withdraw it all like owlcatz said and start think from there. If that is legit won then you have a tons of money to use for with whatever things you want to do.Create a non custodial wallet and stored there the prizes you won. If its in a form of altcoin or stablecoin. Can I ask how did you won with that huge amount?

comments.author: Husires
comments.body: After all these years and all the last events and you did not even think about withdrawing that amount? Or is 2 million normal amounts for you, is it 2 million dollars or 2 million cryptocurrencies?If you have that amount, there is no harm in spending two thousand dollars on a paid advice instead of asking unknown persons here.If you can collect that money with your effort, you will be able to double it.

comments.author: Lucius
comments.body: I wouldn't be too excited with 2.2 million satoshis or something like that - I don't even believe that someone just wins 2.2 million dollars at an online casino - and even less that they ask for advice online Quote from: Dazzy7 on December 02, 2022, 11:56:19 PMOf course, I would be doing giveaways leaderboards and all that, I also need help to navigate a bit as I'm new here, I'll help you as much as you need, but I'm not exactly cheap - let's say 10% of that amount in BTC and you'll manage to do better on the forum very quickly than in your own room That's a joke of course

comments.author: examplens
comments.body: Quote from: Husires on December 03, 2022, 11:12:41 AMIf you can collect that money with your effort, you will be able to double it.he can play roulette on Stake, for example, to put all of this 2.2mil on red. He has a good chance of doubling that amountÂ  I find it a little unrealistic that someone with 2.2 million in a casino account, comes here for advice. considering that it is about a giveaway and throwing away that money, I would rather say that he wants to make "new friends" who will be good to him and ask for some money.

comments.author: nakamura12
comments.body: I would also say that you should withdraw that amount. You can start by dividing the amount to any amount you desire like you will use 10% for giveaways, 25% savings,Â  25% investments if you plan to invest, 15%-30% for business and the rest will be for daily needs. That's only an example on what you will do with that money. Anyway, what are you planning with the forum?. What do you really mean about how to navigate? Do you mean navigate in this forum? We can help you with that as it is what we do here.Quote from: Husires on December 03, 2022, 11:12:41 AMAfter all these years and all the last events and you did not even think about withdrawing that amount? Or is 2 million normal amounts for you, is it 2 million dollars or 2 million cryptocurrencies?If you have that amount, there is no harm in spending two thousand dollars on a paid advice instead of asking unknown persons here.If you can collect that money with your effort, you will be able to double it. That's more likely 2.2m in crypto and it's not before but op RECENTLY WON.

comments.body: Quote from: Dazzy7 on December 02, 2022, 11:56:19 PMI've been in the crypto space since 2019, and have Been on all the highs and lows, I recently won 2.2M on Stake.com. I have no idea what to do with it or how to use it. I'm thinking about starting to make a really good affiliate book on stake, as I noticed it can get really good, Of course, I would be doing giveaways leaderboards and all that, I also need help to navigate a bit as I'm new here, Heard of bitcointalk in 2020 but it looked really confusing, Still kinda is Â  . Anyways If you guys have any suggestions of what I should do let me know, Cheers.  Damn it..this is money can change your life you know,withdraw it then you can sit down relax and think on how to invest with the money. I will advice you to buy Bitcoin with half of the money since Bitcoin price is down so you will be having enough btc and when Bitcoin hits the bull market, man it will be like you gamble you just won so much big profit.You can use share the other part into two and use one part to invest in a business to back up your Bitcoin holdings and the last part of the money,can be used for any purpose of yours.

comments.author: Crypt0Gore
comments.body: Quote from: Dazzy7 on December 02, 2022, 11:56:19 PMI've been in the crypto space since 2019, and have Been on all the highs and lows, I recently won 2.2M on Stake.com. I have no idea what to do with it or how to use it. I'm thinking about starting to make a really good affiliate book on stake, as I noticed it can get really good, Of course, I would be doing giveaways leaderboards and all that, I also need help to navigate a bit as I'm new here, Heard of bitcointalk in 2020 but it looked really confusing, Still kinda isÂ   . Anyways If you guys have any suggestions of what I should do let me know, Cheers. Isn't stake a gambling platform? If thats a yes bro use that money to start a business and invest some in crypto like Bitcoin and few others.Just because you won that 2.2m doesn't mean stake website will be alive like Bitcoin.If your hands are itching then write something about Bitcoin, build books about Bitcoin, not a gambling website that could ruin your rep in future.

comments.author: Dazzy7
comments.body: Quote from: Lucius on December 03, 2022, 11:38:14 AMI wouldn't be too excited with 2.2 million satoshis or something like that - I don't even believe that someone just wins 2.2 million dollars at an online casino - and even less that they ask for advice online Quote from: Dazzy7 on December 02, 2022, 11:56:19 PMOf course, I would be doing giveaways leaderboards and all that, I also need help to navigate a bit as I'm new here, I'll help you as much as you need, but I'm not exactly cheap - let's say 10% of that amount in BTC and you'll manage to do better on the forum very quickly than in your own room That's a joke of courseHey, I actually did win it, It was from a 50,000$ deposit. At that point, I had around 300k in the bank, Was down around 200k in total, Felt lucky and I said fuck it what could go wrong  I knew in my head that a lot of things could go wrong but I went with it. I also opened a Twitter account to share my wins and start that affiliate thing I mentioned before. https://twitter.com/StakeDegen That's my Twitter. I already cashed everything out, around 1.8M to the bank and I have some crypto left. I'm starting to like the forum a lot, I also thank all of you who took the time to respond to me  Wish everyone good luck in their betting, and have a good day.

comments.author: Sandra_hakeem
comments.body: Wait..!!!!!!I'm I getting this straight? Or I'm being too paranoid or what? Are you trying to promote stakes.com here?? Huh  Because if not, what was the purpose of making a post about some audio-wins? Something we ain't even sure, huh? Why should anyone just pop-up from nowhere and propose a giveaway on B/H and everyone's just keeping quiet about it? .....Tskkk!!I've never seen a gambler that won on just a single wager and latter began to propose about writing an affiliate book for the casino, NEVER,!! This only happens if an external person is paid for it or maybe "the person behind the account is already affiliated with stakes.com"...Â  this whole thing looks fishy, especially when the poster bears a newbie account  ...I didn't even click on that link Sandra ðŸ§‘

comments.author: BIT-BENDER
comments.body: I donâ€™t know how stake works but with few replies from here if I were you I would do my legitimate research on its, by the way you did not specify the currency the money is in. If itâ€™s in dollars that is a huge amount.Well we arenâ€™t your financial advisers I donâ€™t think you should have one here, I see the forum as my crypto-currency guide and help but not a forum for financial advice. And if I were you I would probably have nothing to do with gambling again and probably hold some Bitcoin. Like I said take no financial advice just like that from here.

comments.author: Oceat
comments.body: It's a 2.2M$ worth of ETH as what your Twitter posted.I don't know if you like to gamble again or what but you should find someone who can help you with your money like a financial advisor if you don't know what to do with it. Whatever you have plans in your head you should find someone that knows how to handle the money because you might be wasting it just for nothing and money doesn't come down easily especially when winning like that.For us it's like you win in a lottery ticket. Anyway, congratulations!

comments.author: sunsilk
comments.body: Just withdraw it first and update us if it went smoothly, no doubt with stake but if you can share the process of how it went, that will satisfy some of our though cravings.Anyway, with that amount of money, you can do almost anything you want. Start and initiate that book that you want to make for affiliate there and publish it as soon as possible. Aside from that, buy bitcoin, buy real estates and have a passive income from those that you will acquire through rental.

Anyways If you guys have any suggestions of what I should do let me know, Cheers. I am in the crypto space since 2017 but never win as much money as you can right (it makes me jealous lol). with that much winnings, you should be able to invest the majority of the money into bitcoin, the future price of bitcoin will rise high, and now is a good opportunity to buy and multiply.I'm sure you are too busy with your take account so you rarely spend more time on this forum, you have to learn slowly, keep doing what is in accordance with the rules given, and don't do things that are prohibited in this forum (cheating, plagiarism and begging for merit).

comments.author: sheenshane
comments.body: It seems you're promoting Stake.com here.From your Twitter account from here, we know what's your purpose for posting this but to answer your question here's my opinion. It's huge money, it seems so good if you'll seek financial advice with your business plan but IMO, you can invest all half of your winning in Bitcoin, and the rest reserve that amount to gamble again.Â  You were able to manage and won that big amount and I think it isn't hard for you to win that again. I read a thread previously about a complaint of Stake users that they were restricted to with their big fund on that gambling casino, if you withdraw it smoothly update us here.

comments.author: Dazzy7
comments.body: Quote from: sheenshane on December 04, 2022, 11:14:36 PMIt seems you're promoting Stake.com here.From your Twitter account from here, we know what's your purpose for posting this but to answer your question here's my opinion. That's why I'll only use stake when I gamble.

I have no idea what to do with it or how to use it. I'm thinking about starting to make a really good affiliate book on stake, as I noticed it can get really good, Of course, I would be doing giveaways leaderboards and all that, I also need help to navigate a bit as I'm new here, Heard of bitcointalk in 2020 but it looked really confusing, Still kinda isÂ   . Anyways If you guys have any suggestions of what I should do let me know, Cheers. Congratulations on your winning 2.2m which is a huge amount, and am more relaxed and sure that you will get your withdrawal processed asap since you said you won on stake.com.The stake is known for the steady payment without any restriction or demand, unlike other casinos that demand for documents on withdrawal above $5k.

comments.author: JoyMarsha
comments.created_time: December 05, 2022, 11:14:15 PMLast edit: December 05, 2022, 11:33:33 PM by JoyMarsha
comments.body: What I gather from this post of yours is that you are attempting to advertise the stake on which you claimed to have won a sizable sum of money. I'm not saying it's impossible to win this much money, but it makes it difficult for people to accept it when you ask what to do with and how to spend the $2.2 million you earned. Only happiness alone will give you the right sense to buy hundreds of bitcoin, housing estates, skyscrapers, etc. If you actually won that amount, you will be well-known throughout your nation. I can't win that much money and remain silent.
